SEARCH

Class Term

java.lang.Object
Term
All Implemented Interfaces:
Comparable<Term>
public class Term extends Object implements Comparable<Term>
The following class is a template for a term of an algebraic polynomial that involves only one literal. 3x^2 is an example of a term where 3 is the numerical coefficient, x is the literal coefficient and 2 is the degree

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Term()
    Constructs a term with coefficient set to 0, degree set to 0 and literal set to x.
    Term(double coef, char literal, int degree)
    Constructs a term that sets the coefficient, literal and degree to the given the coef, literal and degree

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    int
    compareTo(Term another)
    Return 0 if both degrees are equal Return 1 if degree is greater than the other degree Return -1 if degree is lesser than the other degree
    double
    getCoefficient()
    Returns the numerical coefficient of this term
    int
    getDegree()
    Returns the degree of this term
    char

    Sets the value of the degree of this term to a specified degree
    void
    setLiteral(char literal)
    Sets the value of the literal coefficient of this term to the specified character literal
    String
    toString()
    Returns a string representation of the term that follows a format with the example 3x^2

      literal - the variable or letter (like x)
      degree - the exponent of the literal
